data.title: Cricket Australia on LinkedIn: Our national teams will welcome Pakistan, the West Indies and South Africa‚Ä¶
data.meta_description:
Our national teams will welcome Pakistan, the West Indies and South Africa this summer of cricket!

Full details: https://lnkd.in/gSD3TeMF
data.text:
The dates and location for the National Cricket Inclusion Championships have been locked in üîí The six-day tournament will take place at Marchant Park in Brisbane from January 19-24, 2025, with Queensland Cricket and Warehouse Cricket set to host. This event promises to be an exceptional showcase of talent, determination, and sportsmanship competing at the highest domestic level. This year's championships will continue this tradition, featuring the best cricketers from across Australia as they strive to be crowned national champions. With valued support from Commonwealth Bank, Principal Partner of Cricket Australia's A Sport for All program, and Taverners Australia, the Championships are an integral part of Australian Cricket‚Äôs development pathway. The overarching goal is to have more cricketers with a disability represent Australia at the highest level. Further details, including fixtures for the National Cricket Inclusion Championships, will be made available closer to the event.

Global opportunities üåç Will Taylor, our Social Media Lead (Big Bash Leagues), recently headed over to the UK to work with the Two Circles in the social media space for The Hundred competition! The secondment proved a fantastic opportunity for Will to lend his expertise, while also experiencing how our friends at the England & Wales Cricket Board (ECB) run their rapidly developing domestic competition.

Six months until a historic Test üî• It was great to have Australian Women‚Äôs captain Alyssa Healy and vice-captain Tahlia McGrath at the MCG yesterday as we count down to the first ever day-night Test match from January 30 to February 2. It was also fantastic to welcome Victorian Minister for Tourism, Sport and Major Events Steve Dimopoulos to the MCG to help us celebrate the milestone.

We are pleased to announce that we have extended our audio partnerships with the ABC, SEN and Southern Cross Austereo for the next seven seasons (2024/25 to 2030/31). The extension will ensure cricket fans continue to enjoy a broad and comprehensive range of coverage across AM and FM radio, DAB+ and digital platforms. Read more ‚¨áÔ∏è

Australia‚Äôs massive domestic summer of cricket has been locked in with confirmation of the Sheffield Shield, Women‚Äôs National Cricket League (WNCL), One-Day Cup and T20 Spring Challenge schedules üî• Some of these highlights include: üëâ Four rounds of Sheffield Shield games before the NRMA Insurance Men‚Äôs Border-Gavaskar Trophy Series üëâ The opening rounds of the Sheffield Shield to allow for nationally contracted players to be selected depending on their individual preparation blocks leading into the summer üëâ T20 Spring Challenge played in a 10-day window across Sydney and Adelaide, creating an exciting build-up to the Weber WBBL season while increasing playing opportunities for domestic players üëâ An action-packed start to the men‚Äôs domestic summer with six One-Day Cup games played on consecutive days across Sydney and Melbourne üëâ Each state to host at least three home One-Day Cup matches üëâ Back-to-back white ball finals on the one weekend ‚Äì One-Day Cup Final on March 1 and WNCL Final on March 2 Additional fixtures and tour matches will be announced shortly, including the Prime Minister‚Äôs XI and Governor-General‚Äôs XI matches. You can view the full schedule for the summer of cricket here ‚û°Ô∏è https://lnkd.in/gSYKpxhS

We are pleased to announce the following changes to its Executive Team, with the appointment of Sarah Pragnell to the position of Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and the appointment to James Allsopp to the newly created position of Chief of Cricket. Sarah's appointment follows the earlier resignation of Samantha Douglas as (CFO) and comes after a highly competitive process. James has been appointed the Chief of Cricket, a new role that will oversee all cricket functions including community cricket, talent pathway programs, high performance and national teams.
